data.title: Days After Visiting Birthplace for a Rare Honor, Martina Navratilova Arrives at a Familiar Place to Visit an ‘Old Friend’ and Gives Her Very Own Twist to Taste ‘Strawberries’
data.meta_description: Martina Navratilova recently got honored for her exceptional career and then decided to visit her old friend in London.
data.text:
Martina Navratilova is undoubtedly one of the greatest tennis players of all time, with an incredible record of 59 major titles, including 18 in singles. Her contribution to the sport has been immense. Her achievements have earned her numerous accolades and awards over the years.

The latest recognition came in the form of the silver medal in Prague. It was a medal of the president of the Senate. After receiving such an honor, Martina took a short trip to London to visit one of her ‘old friends’. And shared a snap with her fans on social media.

Martina Navratilova visits London to meet an old friend after receiving an award

Navratilova, who grew up in Řevnice near Prague, expressed her happiness of being back in her homeland and expressed that today’s sports people will not have to leave their own countries to pursue their dreams like in her times. This is a testament to the progress that the Czech Republic has made in recent years, and Navratilova’s achievements have played a significant role in inspiring and motivating young sports enthusiasts in the country.

After receiving an award for her remarkable career, she decided to visit an ‘old friend’ in London. Even though she did not mention who that friend was, she definitely made it clear with a photograph. She is in London to watch Wimbledon. Her Tweet said, “In London for the day, saying hello to an old friend:), And yes, I already had the strawberries. Without cream:)”.

Not only did she visit London to enjoy Wimbledon but also a delightful fruit snack just the way she likes it. The photo she posted is of a prominent location in London called the “Centre Court, South West Hall”.

It is also news that she will be a part of the commentary department at the Wimbledon tournament from the 2nd of July.

Martina gets emotional after receiving an honorable award

After she was honored with such a respectable award, she got emotional. She was diagnosed with breast and throat cancer a while back. Even though she mentioned she was in remission now, the cancer definitely took a toll on her health.

In an interview with Czech Radion, she said, “When the email came from Mr. Vystrčil saying I would receive the silver medal it was sometime in February when I had some health difficulties. I said to myself, Are they afraid I’ll die before they give it to me? They wanted to give it to me in New York, but I could hardly walk. I said, Hopefully, I will come to Řevnice and we’ll manage it when I’m in Prague… It means a lot to me – but you know I’m more used to gold”.

Even after going through such a hard time and battling through a difficult phase, Martina continues to have a humorous approach to life. The silver medal is a fitting tribute to Navratilova’s remarkable career and personal positions.
